greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the generalized Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A(18).
comment: Also known as the 18th Bendersky constant.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 6..2007
formula: A(k) = exp(H(k)*B(k+1)/(k+1) - zeta'(-k)), where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number, H(k) the k-th harmonic number, and zeta'(x) is the derivative of the Riemann Zeta function.
A(18) = exp(18! * Zeta(19) / (2^19 * Pi^18)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 01 2016
results.author: _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 31 2015
